title: Import Wizard, Importing data from array filed results in None Values
body:
When trying to import a JSON similar to this one
```
[
  {
    "filename": "apples.jpg",
    "name": "Face",
    "type": "point",
    "points": [
      {
        "x": 69,
        "y": 213
      }
    ]
  },
  {
    "filename": "apples.jpg",
    "name": "Face",
    "type": "point",
    "points": [
      {
        "x": 65,
        "y": 247
      }
    ]
  },
]
```

And mapping the x, y value in the import wizard like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6606958/173416393-ca91b373-8616-450c-8c7b-7fcf3ca16c9b.png)


We end up getting : 

```
[2022-06-13 11:58:32,841] ERROR annotation.py Line 1447: Error on instance creation {'error': {'filtered_points': 'Must be one point'}, 'info': {'1655143112.8404367': 'Valid Instance Dict'}, 'success': False}
```

```
Instance list is: [{'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]}, {'file_uuid': 'c01d022d-4efa-48e6-bdad-0116aae11cbc', 'type': 'point', 'label_file_id': 104, 'file_name': 'apples.jpg', 'name': 'Face', 'machine_made': False, 'points': [{'x': None, 'y': None}]},
```

Notice that x and y values of the instance list received by the backend is `None`.



## Workaround for now:

Move the x,y values on the JSON file to separate independent keys like this:

```
  {
    "filename": "apples.jpg",
    "name": "Face",
    "type": "point",
    "point_x": 123,
    "point_y" 567
  },
```
And map accordingly on the import wizard UI
